result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: State's Sentencing Recommendations
Email sent to Bay Co Jail advising def has court on Nov 17;  ka

9:16 AM Defendant Tammy M Peters in court.  Attorney John A Best appeared by video for Tammy M Peters.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty ready to go forward.  Parties agree that plea is CT 1.  Court enters judgment and finds GUILTY, direct judgment enter, CT 2 is DRI.  PSI ordered.    Bond is revoked, and remanded into custody.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:47 AM Defendant Tammy M Peters appeared by phone.  Attorney John A Best appeared by video for Tammy M Peters.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Parties have an agreement.  Lab results have now been received.  Back on the record at 8:50, State is going to recommend a $4000 fine.  Attorney and Def in break out room.  Back on the record at 8:56.  Attorney understands offer and fine.  Def wants more time with attorney.  Back on the record at 9:02.  Attorney and def are ready to go forward.  Court is going to put Attorney in a breakout room to deal with another case and bring back and take plea.  Back on the record 9:11.  Parties all in agreement.  Def waives right to personal appearance, discussed that with attorney.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waiving right to personal appearance and accepts waiver.  Arraignment never completed on amended information, waives reading, reviewed with attorney, understands charges and penalties.  Attorney def PLEADS GUILTY, stipulates that has the 5 priors.  File contains PLQ, def understands information, rights giving up and elements.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently pleading guilty, accepts GUILTY PLEA.  As a factual basis can court rely on information in compliant filed, parties agree, court finds a factual basis exists.  Back on the record at 9:32.  Set next date.  58560 argo road mason wi 54858.  7157654741.  Def needs to appear in person for next court date.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:14 AM Prosecuting attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tammy M Peters appeared by video, in custody Byfld Co jail. Waives reading of the compl, waives right to a prelim today. Ct finds know and vol waives right to prelim. Ct finds PC the def com a fel in Ashland Co & bound over for argnmt. State is filing info now, same charges as the compl. Asking for an argnment at a later date
